result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Lewis Brinkman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation by May 5, 2017 by 5:00 p.m.
Court authorizes expungement upon successful completion of Probation as defined by the Court.

  

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to remain on current payment plan with Clerk of Court.
DNA surcharge.

-Defendant to complete MRT.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. DA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros DF: Jonathan Lewis Brinkman appeared. Case called at 4:22. DA Nieskes updates the court. Atty. Petros agrees. Court vacates the DJOC. Court enters the judgment of conviction. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: Sentence W/H. 
Court imposes-
1 year probation with conditions:
- DE to complete MRT
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge $200.00.
- AODA assessment.

Court authorizes expungment up successful completion of probation as defined by the Court. 
Bond is discharged. 
DE to report to probation by 05-05-2017 by 5:00pm
Motion hearing on May 3, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

**AMENDED**

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement on today's date. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in an arrest warrant and/or referral for criminal charges.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing pursuant to the Day Report Center protocols. If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF:  Jonathan Lewis Brinkman appeared pro se. Case called at 8:37. Court reviews file. ADA Kelly updates the court. The state is not going to revoke diversion agreement. DE has an MRT appt. scheduled. DE has moved into the area again to make it easier to complete the program. Court reviews DE right to an atty. with him. DE would like to represent himself today. Court finds DE freely and voluntarily and knowingly waives his right to an Atty. Bond continues.

Apprs: CO: CAR for SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Jens Hubert Loberg DF:  Jonathan Lewis Brinkman appeared. Case called at 9:12. ADA Hartung updates the court, there is an agreement to a diversion agreement. Atty. Loberg responds. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to 15CM526. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 15CM526 but witholds entering the judgment. Court signs the diversion agreement.
Filed by ADA Hartung. km
